intro: Upopion lobatum, commonly known as the Hawaiian pohuehue, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streamside areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Upopion lobatum plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
